newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: LIBERTY GROUP DETAILS FINAL DIVS, CAP AWARDS.
newsitem.headline: LIBERTY GROUP DETAILS FINAL DIVS, CAP AWARDS.

text.p: South Africa's Liberty Life group said on Thursday it will award capitalisation shares to shareholders in four of its group companies and also announced final dividends for the year ended December 31, 1996.

It said Liberty Life Association of Africa Ltd had declared a final dividend of of 180 cents a share compared with 140 in the second half of 1995, raising the full 1996 year payout to 320 cents versus 256 cents before.

Liberty Life will award capitalisation shares to shareholders in the ratio that 180 cents multiplied by 1.06 bears to the closing price of the firm's shares on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange on March 26 averaged with the closing prices on the four preceding business days.
Liberty Holdings Ltd had declared a final dividend of 518 cents, up 35.6 percent on 1995. Payout for the full year was 900 cents compared with 700 cents before.

Liberty Holdings will award capitalisation shares to shareholders in the ratio that 518 cents multiplied by 1.06 bears to the closing price of the firm's shares on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange on March 26 averaged with the closing prices on the four preceding business days.
Liblife Strategic Investments Ltd's had declared a final dividend of 21 cents bringing the full year dividend to 39 cents compared with 32 cents in 1995.
Liberty Investors Ltd had declared a 31 cents final dividend lifting the full year dividend to 52 cents -- a 26.8 percent increase of 1995.
Payment of dividends and cap awards will take place around April 4 to shareholders on the companies' registers on February 28.
Preliminary results for the four group companies' 1996 financial year will be published around March 13.
